speakerInfo.speakerBio: Louie Schwartzberg is a cinematographer, director and producer who captures breathtaking images that celebrate life -- revealing connections, universal rhythms, patterns and beauty.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Britta Riley designs and builds urban farms  and other participatory artworks that explore the city.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Damon Horowitz explores what is possible at the boundaries of technology and the humanities.

talkTitle: Philosophy in prison

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Kathryn Schulz is a staff writer for the New Yorker and is the author of "Being Wrong: Adventures in the Margin of Error."

talkTitle: Don't regret regret

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Annie Murphy Paul investigates how life in the womb shapes who we become.

talkTitle: What we learn before we're born

speakerInfo.speakerBio: John Bohannon is a scientist and writer who runs the annual Dance Your Ph.D. contest.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Charles Limb is a doctor and a musician who researches the way musical creativity works in the brain.

talkTitle: Building the musical muscle

speakerInfo.speakerBio: A performing poet since she was 14 years old, Sarah Kay is the founder of Project VOICE, an organization that uses spoken word poetry as a literacy and empowerment tool.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Luis von Ahn builds systems that combine humans and computers to solve large-scale problems that neither can solve alone.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Cheryl Hayashi studies the delicate but terrifically strong silk threads that make up a spider's web, finding startling applications for human use.

talkTitle: The magnificence of spider silk

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Stefon Harris plays the vibraphone -- and leads a jazz ensemble with a collaborative sound built on collective inspiration.

talkTitle: There are no mistakes on the bandstand

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Monika Bulaj’s stunning, painting-like photographs blur religious and cultural divisions, exploding stereotypes. She is a TED Fellow.

talkTitle: The hidden light of Afghanistan

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Quyen Nguyen uses molecular probes that make tumors -- and just the tumors -- glow, as an extraordinary aid to surgeons.

talkTitle: Color-coded surgery

speakerInfo.speakerBio: A banker by training, Pavan Sukhdev runs the numbers on greening up -- showing that green economies are an effective engine for creating jobs and creating wealth.

talkTitle: Put a value on nature!

speakerInfo.speakerBio: The executive chef at Chicago's Moto restaurant, Homaro Cantu created postmodern cuisine and futuristic food delivery systems.

talkTitle: Cooking as alchemy

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Antonio Damasio's research in neuroscience has shown that emotions play a central role in social cognition and decision-making. His work has had a major influence on current understanding of the neural systems, which underlie memory, language, consciousness.

talkTitle: The quest to understand consciousness

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Sheila Nirenberg studies how the brain encodes information -- possibly allowing us to decode it, and maybe develop prosthetic sensory devices.

talkTitle: A prosthetic eye to treat blindness

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Daniel Goldstein studies how we make decisions about our financial selves -- both now and in the future,

talkTitle: The battle between your present and future self

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Alberto Cairo leads the International Red Cross' orthopedic rehabilitation work in Afghanistan.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Immersing himself in alternate lifestyles and long, hilarious experiments (usually with himself the guinea pig), writer AJ Jacobs tests the limits of behavior, customs, culture, knowledge -- and his wife's sense of humor.

talkTitle: How healthy living nearly killed me

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Jane Fonda has had three extraordinary careers (so far): Oscar-winning actor, fitness guru, impassioned activist.

talkTitle: Life's third act

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Paddy Ashdown is a former member of the British Parliament and a diplomat with a lifelong commitment to international cooperation.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: After making a splash in the field of bioinformatics, Sebastian Wernicke moved on to the corporate sphere, where he motivates and manages multidimensional projects.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Michelle Borkin is a PhD candidate in applied physics. She works with the Astronomical Medicine Project and interdisciplinary 3D visualization techniques.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Jonas Gahr Støre is the Norwegian Foreign Minister, charged with working for Norway's interests internationally.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Drew Berry creates stunning and scientifically accurate animations to illustrate how the molecules in our cell move and interact.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Sonaar Luthra is the creator of Water Canary, a water-testing device that collects real-time water-quality data from the field.

talkTitle: Meet the Water Canary

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Through his witty and literate books -- and his new School of Life  -- Alain de Botton helps others find fulfillment in the everyday.

talkTitle: Atheism 2.0

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Clay Shirky argues that the history of the modern world could be rendered as the history of ways of arguing, where changes in media change what sort of arguments are possible -- with deep social and political implications.

talkTitle: Why SOPA is a bad idea

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Sheena Iyengar studies how people choose (and what makes us think we're good at it).

talkTitle: How to make choosing easier

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Julian Baggini is a journalist and philosopher who studies the complexities of personal identity. He is the editor-in-chief of the Philosophers' Magazine.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Lisa Harouni is the co-founder of Digital Forming, working in "additive manufacturing" -- or 3D printing.

talkTitle: A primer on 3D printing

speakerInfo.speakerBio: A record-setting long-distance swimmer, Diana Nyad writes and thinks deeply about motivation.

talkTitle: Extreme swimming with the world's most dangerous jellyfish

speakerInfo.speakerBio: As CEO of InteraXon, Ariel Garten works to close the gap between science, art, business and technology.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Gayle Tzemach Lemmon writes about women around the world living their lives at war and in conflict zones.

talkTitle: Women entrepreneurs, example not exception

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Mick Mountz is the founder and CEO of Kiva Systems, making high-tech products for fast, cheap and efficient inventory fulfillment. In March 2012, Kiva was acquired by Amazon.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: General Peter van Uhm is the Chief of the Netherlands Defence staff.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: With his company Novocure, Bill Doyle works to bring breakthrough medical technologies to doctors and patients.

talkTitle: Treating cancer with electric fields

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Shawn Achor is the CEO of Good Think Inc., where he researches and teaches about positive psychology.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: At Gradian Health Systems, Erica Frenkel works to bring safe anesthesia to hospitals all over the world.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Inventor, scientist, author, engineer -- over his broad career, Danny Hillis has turned his ever-searching brain on an array of subjects, with surprising results.

talkTitle: Back to the future (of 1994)

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Nancy Duarte believes that ideas are the most powerful tools people have.  Her passion is to help every person learn to communicate their world-changing idea effectively.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: At University College in London, Neil Burgess researches how patterns of electrical activity in brain cells guide us through space.

talkTitle: How your brain tells you where you are

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Photographer Erik Johansson creates impossible but photorealistic images that capture an idea, not a moment.

talkTitle: Impossible photography

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Paul Conneally is the public communications manager for the International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, and a leader in using digital technologies for humanitarian aid.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Garth Lenz’ touring exhibition, “The True Cost of Oil”, has played a major part in the fight against Alberta Tar Sands Mining.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Lucianne Walkowicz works on NASA's Kepler mission, studying starspots and "the tempestuous tantrums of stellar flares."

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: The writer and presenter of the BBC Radio 4 series "A History of the World in 100 Objects" and the accompanying book.

talkTitle: 2600 years of history in one object

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Shilo Shiv Suleman is an illustrator, storyteller and iPad book creator.

talkTitle: Using tech to enable dreaming

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Avi Rubin is a professor of computer science and director of the Health and Medical Security Lab at Johns Hopkins University. His research is focused on the security of electronic records -- including medical and voting records.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Kevin Allocca is YouTube's expert on the intersection of web video and global culture

talkTitle: Why videos go viral

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Paul Snelgrove led the group that pulled together the findings of the Census of Marine Life -- synthesizing 10 years and 540 expeditions into a book of wonders.

talkTitle: A census of the ocean

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Daniel Pauly is the principal investigator at the Sea Around Us Project, which studies the impact of the world's fisheries on marine ecosystems. The software he's helped develop is used around the world to model and track the ocean.

talkTitle: The ocean's shifting baseline

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Paul Gilding is an independent writer, activist and adviser on a sustainable economy. Click through to watch the onstage debate that followed this talk.

talkTitle: The Earth is full

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Peter Diamandis runs the X Prize Foundation, which offers large cash incentive prizes to inventors who can solve grand challenges like space flight, low-cost mobile medical diagnostics and oil spill cleanup. He is the chair of Singularity University, which teaches executives and grad students about exponentially growing technologies.

talkTitle: Abundance is our future

speakerInfo.speakerBio: As the dean of the University of Pennsylvania's School of Engineering and Applied Science, Vijay Kumar studies the control and coordination of multi-robot formations.

talkTitle: Robots that fly ... and cooperate

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Our world prizes extroverts—but Susan Cain makes a case for the quiet and contemplative. She reaches millions of people through her books, podcasts and her mission-based organization, Quiet Revolution, which empowers introverts for the benefit of everyone.

talkTitle: The power of introverts

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Bryan Stevenson is the founder and executive director of the Equal Justice Initiative, fighting poverty and challenging racial discrimination in the criminal justice system.

talkTitle: We need to talk about an injustice

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Andrew Stanton has made you laugh and cry. The writer behind the three "Toy Story" movies and the writer/director of "WALL-E," he releases his new film, "John Carter," in March.

talkTitle: The clues to a great story

speakerInfo.speakerBio: James Hansen has made key insights into our global climate -- and inspired a generation of activists and scientists.

talkTitle: Why I must speak out about climate change

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Jennifer Pahlka is the founder of Code for America, which matches software geniuses with US cities to reboot local services.

talkTitle: Coding a better government

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Colin Robertson is apparently "attempting to make the world's first crowdsourced solar energy solution" Or is he?

talkTitle: A TED speaker's worst nightmare

speakerInfo.speakerTitle: Professor of Economics, University of Waterloo
speakerInfo.speakerBio: A professor of economics at the University of Waterloo in Canada, Larry Smith coaches his students to find the careers that they will truly love.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Jonathan Haidt studies how -- and why -- we evolved to be moral and political creatures.

talkTitle: Religion, evolution, and the ecstasy of self-transcendence

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Rob Reid is a humor author and the founder of the company that created the music subscription service Rhapsody.

talkTitle: The $8 billion iPod

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Brené Brown studies vulnerability, courage, authenticity, and shame.

talkTitle: Listening to shame

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Scott Summit uses his 20 years of experience as an industrial designer to make artificial limbs that help people take personal control of these intimate objects.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: A legendary oil and gas entrepreneur, T. Boone Pickens is now on a mission to enhance U.S. energy policies to lessen the nation’s dependence on OPEC oil.

talkTitle: Let's transform energy — with natural gas

speakerInfo.speakerBio: At 14, Taylor Wilson became the youngest person to achieve fusion -- with a reactor born in his garage. Now he wants to save our seaports from nuclear terror.

talkTitle: Yup, I built a nuclear fusion reactor

speakerInfo.speakerBio: A two-term U.S. Poet Laureate, Billy Collins captures readers with his understated wit, profound insight -- and a sense of being "hospitable."

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Over the past 35 years Peter Saul has been intimately involved in the dying process for over 4,000 patients. He is passionate about improving the ways we die.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Donald Sadoway is working on a battery miracle -- an inexpensive, incredibly efficient, three-layered battery using “liquid metal."

talkTitle: The missing link to renewable energy

speakerInfo.speakerBio: As director of the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA), Regina Dugan oversaw the US armed forces' innovation engine. Now she deploys the same research tactics at Google.

talkTitle: From mach-20 glider to hummingbird drone

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Leymah Gbowee is a peace activist in Liberia. She led a women's movement that was pivotal in ending the Second Liberian Civil War in 2003, and now speaks on behalf of women and girls around the world.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Ayah Bdeir is an engineer and artist, and is the founder of littleBits and karaj, an experimental art, architecture and technology lab in Beirut.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Marco Tempest is a cyber illusionist, combining magic and technology to produce astonishing illusions.

talkTitle: A magical tale (with augmented reality)

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Rick Falkvinge, didn’t plan on becoming a politician, but his dedication to civil liberties and internet sovereignty led to him founding the Swedish Pirate Party in 2006.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Sherry Turkle studies how technology is shaping our modern relationships: with others, with ourselves, with it.

talkTitle: Connected, but alone?

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Chip Kidd's book jacket designs spawned a revolution in the art of American book packaging.

talkTitle: Designing books is no laughing matter. OK, it is.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Jack is the CEO of Anatomage, a company specializing on 3D medical technology.

talkTitle: On the virtual dissection table

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Frank Warren is the creator of the PostSecret Project, a blog full of secrets anonymously shared via postcard.

talkTitle: Half a million secrets

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Frans de Waal studies primate social behavior -- how they fight and reconcile, share and cooperate.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Melinda French Gates is co-chair of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, where she puts into practice the idea that every life has equal value.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Tal Golesworthy is an engineer and entrepreneur, working in research and development of combustion and air pollution control -- until he decided to innovate in his own health.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Abigail Washburn pairs venerable folk elements with far-flung sounds, creating results that feel both strangely familiar and unlike anything anybody's ever heard before.

talkTitle: Building US-China relations ... by banjo

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Surgeon and public health professor by day, writer by night, Atul Gawande explores how doctors can dramatically improve their practice using approaches as simple as a checklist – or coaching.

talkTitle: How do we heal medicine?

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Drew Curtis is the founder and administrator of Fark.com.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: With a large-format camera and a knack for talking her way into forbidden zones, Taryn Simon photographs portions of the American infrastructure inaccessible to its inhabitants.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Laura Carstensen is the director of the Stanford Center on Longevity, and has extensively studied the effects on wellbeing of extended lifetimes.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Christina Warinner is a researcher at the University of Zurich, where she studies how humans have co-evolved with environments, diets and disease.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Brian Greene is perhaps the best-known proponent of superstring theory, the idea that minuscule strands of energy vibrating in a higher dimensional space-time create every particle and force in the universe.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Through clever studies, Michael Norton studies how we feel about what we buy and spend.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Mayor Eduardo Paes is on a mission to ensure that Rio's renaissance creates a positive legacy for all its citizens.

talkTitle: The 4 commandments of cities

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Joe Smith is an active figure in the Oregon community and a powerful advocate for proper paper towel use.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Brenda Romero designs games that turn some of history's most tragic lessons into interactive, emotional experiences.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Liz Diller and her maverick firm DS+R bring a groundbreaking approach to big and small projects in architecture, urban design and art -- playing with new materials, tampering with space and spectacle in ways that make you look twice.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: In his new book, "Reinventing Fire," Amory Lovins shares ingenious ideas for the next era of energy.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Reuben Margolin's moving sculptures combine the logic of math with the sensuousness of nature.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Gary Kovacs is a technologist and the former CEO of the Mozilla Corporation, where he directed the development of Firefox.

talkTitle: Tracking our online trackers

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Rory Sutherland stands at the center of an advertising revolution in brand identities, designing cutting-edge, interactive campaigns that blur the line between ad and entertainment.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Tavi Gevinson is a fashion blogger and a feminist who encourages everyone to embrace their complexity and look cool doing it.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Photographer Rick Guidotti sees a rich beauty in our genetic diversity and works to expose that vision to everyone.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Conductor Michael Tilson Thomas (call him MTT) is an all-around music educator -- connecting with global audiences, young musicians and concertgoers in San Francisco and London.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Karen Bass has traveled the world to explore and capture footage from every environment across the Earth.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Joshua Foer is a science writer who 'accidentally' won the U.S. Memory Championship.

talkTitle: Feats of memory anyone can do

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Renny Gleeson helps navigate brands through fresh concepts, such as viral marketing and social media, to find the pulse of the modern consumer.

talkTitle: 404, the story of a page not found

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Tali Sharot studies why our brains are biased toward optimism.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Jean-Baptiste Michel looks at how we can use large volumes of data to better understand our world.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: David Kelley’s company IDEO helped create many icons of the digital generation -- but what matters even more to him is unlocking the creative potential of people and organizations to innovate routinely.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Carl Schoonover is a neuroscientist and one of the founders of NeuWrite, a collaboration between writers and neuroscientist.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Michael McDaniel is a graphic designer using his skills to help people in meaningful ways.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Melissa Garren is a molecular and marine biologist with a passion for unlocking the mysteries of our ocean's ecosystems and finding new avenues for conservation.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Armed with blood samples, high-tech tools and a small army of fieldworkers, Nathan Wolfe hopes to re-invent pandemic control -- and reveal hidden secrets of the planet's dominant lifeform: the virus.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: In Hans Rosling’s hands, data sings. Global trends in health and economics come to vivid life. And the big picture of global development—with some surprisingly good news—snaps into sharp focus.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Anthony Magliano and Mica Thomas are the founder and artistic directors of Quixotic, a mixed-media theater/performance/aerialist company.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Juan Enriquez thinks and writes about the profound changes that genomics and other life sciences will bring in business, technology, politics and society.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Ami Klin is an award winning autism spectrum disorder researcher finding new avenues for early diagnosis.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Journalist Megan Kamerick fights for well-balanced storytelling in media.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Journalist and commentator John Hockenberry has reported from all over the world in virtually every medium. He's the author of "Moving Violations: War Zones, Wheelchairs and Declarations of Independence."

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Rebecca Onie is the founder of Health Leads, a program that connects patients to basic care and resources, such as food and housing, that are the root cause of many health problems.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Beeban Kidron directed Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason and Oranges Are Not the Only Fruit. She also cofounded FILMCLUB, a charity for students devoted to the art of storytelling through film.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: David R. Dow has defended over 100 death row inmates in 20 years.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Marco Tempest is a cyber illusionist, combining magic and technology to produce astonishing illusions.

talkTitle: The electric rise and fall of Nikola Tesla

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Wolfgang Kessling and his team at Transsolar designed the solar cooling and comfort concepts that helped Qatar win the bid for the 2022 football World Cup.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Raghava KK's paintings and drawings use cartoonish shapes and colors to examine the body, society, our world.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Biologist E.O. Wilson explores the world of ants and other tiny creatures, and writes movingly about the way all creatures great and small are interdependent.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Peter Norvig is a leading American computer scientist, expert on artificial intelligence and the Director of Research at Google Inc.

talkTitle: The 100,000-student classroom

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Performance artist and storyteller Rives has been called "the first 2.0 poet," using images, video and technology to bring his words to life.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Boaz Almog uses quantum physics to levitate and trap objects in midair. Call it "quantum levitation."

talkTitle: How I'm preparing to get Alzheimer's

speakerInfo.speakerBio: TED Senior Fellow Cesar Harada aims to harness the forces of nature as he invents innovative remedies for man-made problems like oil spills and radioactive leaks.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Preston Reed’s hands have an otherworldly coordination. The fingers, nails, thumbs, and palms of both left and right dance, pluck, strum, and slap his guitar, which bursts with a full sound.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Reality is broken, says Jane McGonigal, and we need to make it work more like a game. Her work shows us how.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Jonathan Eisen studies the ecology and evolution of microbial communities -- and their co-evolution with their hosts.

talkTitle: Meet your microbes

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Gabe Barcia-Colombo creates madcap art inspired both by Renaissance era curiosity cabinets and the modern-day digital chronicling of everyday life. Think: miniature people projected in objects and a DNA Vending Machine.

talkTitle: Capturing memories in video art

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Mina Bissell studies how cancer interacts with our bodies, searching for clues to how cancer's microenvironment influences its growth.

talkTitle: Experiments that point to a new understanding of cancer

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Neil Harbisson's "eyeborg" allows him to hear colors, even those beyond the range of sight.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Matt Mills comes from Aurasma, a startup that makes augmented-reality technology for mobile phones.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Vinay Venkatraman aims to design technological devices for the "bottom of the pyramid" rather than simply for the affluent.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Computer programmer John Graham-Cumming keeps geek history alive by raising awareness for it's heroes and their inventions.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Malte Spitz asked his cell phone carrier what it knew about him -- and mapped what he found out.

talkTitle: Your phone company is watching

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Michael Hansmeyer is an architect and programmer who explores the use of algorithms and computation to generate architectural form.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Novelist Tracy Chevalier is the author of "Girl With a Pearl Earring."

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Michael Anti (Zhao Jing), a key figure in China's new journalism, explores the growing power of the Chinese internet.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Rob Legato creates surprising and creative visual illusions for movies.

talkTitle: The art of creating awe

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Mark Applebaum has built an instrument out of doorstops and combs, as well as composed a piece of music to be performed by a florist.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Wayne McGregor and his dancers explore the uncharted territory where mind and movement intersect.

talkTitle: A choreographer's creative process in real time

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Giles Duley began his career as a fashion photographer. When it was time for a change he found himself on a journey of war and hardship.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Stephen Ritz teaches at-risk kids in the South Bronx.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: The former CEO of five businesses, Margaret Heffernan explores the all-too-human thought patterns -- like conflict avoidance and selective blindness -- that lead organizations and managers astray.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Max Little is a mathematician whose research includes a breakthrough technique to monitor – and potentially screen for – Parkinson's disease through simple voice recordings.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Kirby Ferguson explores creativity in a world where "everything is a remix."

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Pam Warhurst cofounded Incredible Edible, an initiative in Todmorden, England dedicated to growing food locally by planting on unused land throughout the community.

talkTitle: How we can eat our landscapes

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Lisa Kristine uses photography to expose deeply human stories.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Scilla Elworthy founded Oxford Research Group in 1982, to promote effective dialogue between nuclear weapons policy-makers and their opponents.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: When a freak tornado hit her Massachusetts hometown, Caitria O’Neill wasn't an expert in disaster relief recovery. But she learned quickly and is now passing her knowledge on through the website Recovers.org.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Clay Shirky argues that the history of the modern world could be rendered as the history of ways of arguing, where changes in media change what sort of arguments are possible -- with deep social and political implications.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: From his home base in Bulgaria, Ivan Krastev thinks about democracy -- and how to reframe it.

talkTitle: Can democracy exist without trust?

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Mark Forsyth strolls through the English language, telling stories, making connections and banishing hobgoblins.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Timothy Prestero loves a flashy "concept car." But in his own work, he aims to design products for social impact, keeping users in mind.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: A Tony Award winner, theater producer David Binder is interested in taking performances off the stage.

talkTitle: The arts festival revolution

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Candy Chang creates art that prompts people to think about their secrets, wishes and hopes -- and then share them. She is a TED Senior Fellow.

talkTitle: Before I die I want to ...

speakerInfo.speakerBio: In her reporting and writing, Leslie T. Chang explores the lives of workers in China, focusing on the experience of women.

talkTitle: The voices of China's workers

speakerInfo.speakerBio: To research his book, "Stealth of Nations," Robert Neuwirth spent four years among street vendors, smugglers and “informal” import/export firms.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Vikram Patel helps bring better mental health care to low-resource communities -- by teaching ordinary people to deliver basic psychiatric services.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: A lawyer by training and a techie by inclination, Beth Noveck works to build data transparency into government.

talkTitle: Demand a more open-source government

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Kent Larson designs new technologies that solve the biggest questions facing our cities.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Scott Fraser is a forensic psychologist who thinks deeply about the fallibility of human memory and encourages a more scientific approach to trial evidence.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Not only does Jonathan Trent grow algae for biofuel, he wants to do so by cleansing wastewater and trapping carbon dioxide in the process. And it’s all solar-powered.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Tristram Stuart sounds the warning bell on global food waste, calling for us to change the systems whereby large quantities of produce and other foods end up in trash heaps.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Ed Gavagan was walking down the street in downtown Manhattan when he was the victim of a gang assignment to kill a random stranger. He lives to tell the amazing story.

talkTitle: A story about knots and surgeons

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Ellen Jorgensen is at the leading edge of the do-it-yourself biotechnology movement, bringing scientific exploration and understanding to the public.

talkTitle: Biohacking — you can do it, too

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Amy Cuddy’s research on body language reveals that we can change other people’s perceptions — and perhaps even our own body chemistry — simply by changing body positions.

talkTitle: Your body language may shape who you are

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Shimon Schocken is a computer science professor and dedicated educator.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Rachel Botsman is a recognized expert on how collaboration and trust enabled by digital technologies will change the way we live, work, bank and consume.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: What does "normal behavior" look like? To find out, Read Montague is imaging thousands of brains at work.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Ben Goldacre unpicks dodgy scientific claims made by scaremongering journalists, dubious government reports, pharmaceutical corporations, PR companies and quacks.

talkTitle: What doctors don't know about the drugs they prescribe

speakerInfo.speakerBio: For his new book, "Tubes," Andrew Blum visited the places where the internet exists in physical form: the cables and switches and servers that virtually connect us.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Thomas P. Campbell, director of The Metropolitan Museum of Art, aims to make the venerable museum's offerings both narrative-driven and accessible.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Our environment changes faster than we can learn about it, Eddie Obeng says. How do we keep up?

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Ryan Merkley is the Chief Operating Officer at the Mozilla Foundation, and is dedicated to making the web a more user-friendly place.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Aris Venetikidis imagines how maps work with our minds.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Vicki Arroyo uses environmental law and her background in biology and ecology to help prepare for global climate change.

talkTitle: Let's prepare for our new climate

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Imagine the discoveries that could result from a giant pool of freely available health and genomic data. John Wilbanks is working to build it.

talkTitle: Let's pool our medical data

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Jason McCue litigates against terrorists, dictators and others who seem above the law, using the legal and judicial system in innovative ways.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Beau Lotto is founder of Lottolab, a hybrid art studio and science lab. With glowing, interactive sculpture -- and old-fashioned peer-reviewed research--he's illuminating the mysteries of the brain's visual system.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Maurizio Seracini uses advanced tools common in engineering and medical labs to unravel centuries-old mysteries of art.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: A humanist in Silicon Valley, Tim Leberecht argues that in a time of artificial intelligence, big data and the quantification of everything, we are losing sight of the importance of the emotional and social aspects of our work.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Melissa Marshall aims to teach great communication skills to scientists and engineers, so that they can effectively share their work.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Our world is not flat, says ecnomist Pankaj Ghemawat -- it's at best semi-globalized, with limited interactions between countries and economies.

talkTitle: Actually, the world isn't flat

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Rory Stewart -- a perpetual pedestrian, a diplomat, an adventurer and an author -- is the member of British Parliament for Penrith and the Border.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: An award-winning playwright and popular broadcaster in the UK, as well as the author of five poetry books, Lemn Sissay has a way with words.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: David Pizarro is a psychologist interested in how certain emotions (disgust, fear, anger) affect our moral judgment.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Doris Kim Sung is a biology student turned architect interested in thermo-bimetals, smart materials that respond dynamically to temperature change.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Sanjay Pradhan is vice president of the World Bank Institute, helping leaders in developing countries learn skills for reform, development and good governance.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Writer Faith Jegede Cole draws on her experiences growing up with two autistic brothers in order to spread awareness and understanding about this increasingly common diagnosis.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Georgette Mulheir is a pioneer for the movement to end child abuse in the form of orphanages.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Hannah Brencher believes in the power of pen and paper, and has started a global initiative that encourages strangers to exchange love letters.

talkTitle: Love letters to strangers

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Gary Greenberg is a photographer, biomedical researcher and inventor intent on giving us all a view of the microscopic wonders all around us.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Emma Teeling, Director of the Centre for Irish Bat Research, thinks we have a lot to learn from the biology of bats.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Researcher Matt Killingsworth designs studies that gather data on happiness. One takeaway? "A Wandering Mind Is an Unhappy Mind."

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Jake Wood runs Team Rubicon, a nationwide nonprofit that provides military veterans with the opportunity to continue their service by responding to natural disasters and global crises.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Daphne Bavelier studies how the brain adapts to changes in experience, either by nature or by training.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Aspiring Olympic skier Janine Shepherd was nearly killed when she was hit by a truck during a training bike ride. Paralysed and immobile for six months, she was given a grim picture for recovery. But not only did she teach herself to walk again— she learned to fly.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Bobby Ghosh is the Managing Editor at Quartz.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Once an up-and-coming star in the Missouri State Senate, Jeff Smith went to prison for covering up an election law violation. Since his release, he's created a new space for himself as a professor, writer, political commentator and advocate for those he was locked up with.

talkTitle: Lessons in business ... from prison

speakerInfo.speakerBio: A founding member of the Axis of Evil Comedy Tour, Iranian-American comedian Maz Jobrani is now touring with his second solo comedy show, Browner and Friendlier.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Neuroscientist Molly Crockett studies altruism, morality and value-based decision-making in humans.

talkTitle: Beware neuro-bunk

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Steven Addis is a father and photography buff who, by day, harnesses the power of branding for social change.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Fiction writer Karen Thompson Walker explores the connection between fear and the imagination.

talkTitle: What fear can teach us

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Adam Davidson is the co-host and co-creator of "Planet Money," a weekly podcast and radio feature about the economy.

talkTitle: What we learned from teetering on the fiscal cliff

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Mindfulness expert Andy Puddicombe wants to make meditation accessible to everybody: for a happier, healthier you.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Cameron Russell has stomped the runways for Victoria's Secret and Chanel, and has appeared in many magazines. But she is much more than just a pretty face.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Dermatologist Richard Weller wants to know: Why are Scots so sick?

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: The director of communications for the non-profit Citizen Schools, Colin Stokes thinks deeply about the media he shares with his two young children.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Janine di Giovanni reports from war zones around the world.

talkTitle: What I saw in the war

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Dr. Steven Schwaitzberg is on a mission to teach surgeons around the world to perform minimally invasive surgery. But first, he's had to find the right technology to allow communication across the language barrier.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Leslie Morgan Steiner is a writer and outspoken advocate for survivors of domestic violence -- which includes herself.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Tyler DeWitt recognizes that textbooks are not the way to get young people interested in science. Instead, he teaches science by making it fun and fantastical.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Wingham Rowan's work bridges the gap between flexible work schedules and modern financial markets.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Mitch Resnick directs the Lifelong Kindergarten group at MIT Media Lab, dedicated to helping kids of all ages tinker and experiment with design.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: As a child actor, iO Tillett Wright turned his shoes around in the bathroom stall so that people would think he was a boy. As a teenager, he fell in love with both women and men. His life in the gray areas of gender and sexuality deeply inform his work as an artist.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Shabana Basij-Rasikh helps girls and young women in Afghanistan get an education.

talkTitle: Dare to educate Afghan girls

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Psychotherapist Esther Perel is changing the conversation on what it means to be in love and have a fulfilling sex life.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Kakenya Ntaiya refused to accept the continued oppression of women in her Maasai village -- so she built a school that's shifting gender expectations in her community.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: A leading expert in the fields of property valuation and project management, Afra Raymond is battling the government corruption rampant in his country, Trinidad and Tobago.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Most people are irritated by the buzzing of a fly's wings. But biologist Michael Dickinson views the sound with a deep sense of wonder.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Bruno Maisonnier founded Aldebaran Robotics, maker of the tiny, compelling humanoid Nao.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Educational researcher Sugata Mitra is the winner of the 2013 TED Prize. His wish: Build a School in the Cloud, where children can explore and learn from one another.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: We dream boldly in the dimension of our doing, but set the bar no higher than stability in our emotional lives. It’s time to dream in multiple dimensions at the same time, says AIDSRide Founder Dan Pallotta. He aims to transform the way society thinks about giving, and being.

talkTitle: The way we think about charity is dead wrong

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Through his lab at the California Institute of Technology, David Anderson seeks to find the neural underpinnings of emotions like fear, anxiety and anger.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Since the counterculture '60s, Stewart Brand has been creating our internet-worked world. Now, with biotech accelerating four times faster than digital technology, Stewart Brand has a bold new plan ...

speakerInfo.speakerBio: As a child growing up in North Korea, Hyeonseo Lee thoght her country was the "best on the planet." It wasn't until the famine of the 90s that she began to wonder. She escaped the country at 17-years-old to begin a life in hiding as a refugee in China. Hers is a harrowing, personal tale of survival and hope -- and a powerful reminder of those who face constant danger, even when the border is far behind.

talkTitle: My escape from North Korea

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Young inventor Richard Turere invented "lion lights," an elegant way to protect his family's cattle from lion attacks.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Mark Shaw develops technologies to contain hazardous waste, storm water and radioactives.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Colin Camerer is a leading behavioral economist who studies the psychological and neural bases of choice and strategic decision-making.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Lawrence Lessig has already transformed intellectual-property law with his Creative Commons innovation. Now he's focused on an even bigger problem: The US' broken political system.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Kees Moeliker writes and speaks about natural history, especially birds and remarkable animal behavior, as well as improbable research and science-communication-with-a-laugh.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: The dismal science of economics is not as firmly grounded in actual behavior as was once supposed. In "Predictably Irrational," Dan Ariely told us why.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Skylar Tibbits, a TED Fellow, is an artist and computational architect working on "smart" components that can assemble themselves.

talkTitle: The emergence of "4D printing"

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Ken Jennings holds the record for most consecutive wins on the classic American trivia game show, Jeopardy.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: During his 20-year tenure as president of UMBC, Freeman Hrabowski has helped students of all backgrounds pursue degrees in arts, humanities and the sciences.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TED-curated event in partnership with Intel.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Laura Snyder weaves tales of Victorian-era scientists that have been described as “fit for Masterpiece Theater.”

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Rose George looks deeply into topics that are unseen but fundamental, whether that's sewers or latrines or massive container ships or pirate hostages or menstrual hygiene.

talkTitle: Let's talk crap. Seriously.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: The Director of the National Institute of Mental Health, Thomas Insel supports research that will help us understand, treat and even prevent mental disorders.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Joshua Prager’s journalism unravels historical secrets -- and his own.

talkTitle: In search of the man who broke my neck

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Twice the world yo-yo champion, BLACK mixes dance, sport and performance to create unforgettable yo-yo moments.

talkTitle: My journey to yo-yo mastery

speakerInfo.speakerBio: The chair of neurosurgery at the University of Toronto, Andres Lozano has pioneered the use of deep brain stimulation for treating Parkinson’s, depression, anorexia and Alzheimer’s disease.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Linguist John McWhorter thinks about language in relation to race, politics and our shared cultural history.

talkTitle: Txtng is killing language. JK!!!

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Robert J. Gordon is among the most influential macroeconomists in the world. And the big picture he sees is not altogether rosy.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Erik Brynjolfsson examines the effects of information technologies on business strategy, productivity and employment.

talkTitle: The key to growth? Race with the machines

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Beijing-based artist Liu Bolin silently comments on modern sociopolitical conditions by disappearing into his art.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: A research scientist at Intel, Jennifer Healey develops the mobile internet devices of the future.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TED-curated event in partnership with Intel.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: David Pogue is the personal technology columnist for the New York Times and a tech correspondent for CBS News. He's also one of the world's bestselling how-to authors, with titles in the For Dummies series and his own line of "Missing Manual" books.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Business innovator Nilofer Merchant thinks deeply about the frameworks, strategies and cultural values of companies.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: At 14, Taylor Wilson became the youngest person to achieve fusion -- with a reactor born in his garage. Now he wants to save our seaports from nuclear terror.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Rita F. Pierson spent her entire life in or around the classroom, having followed both her parents and grandparents into a career as an educator.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Geoffrey Canada has spent decades as head of the Harlem Children’s Zone, which supports kids from birth through college in order to break the cycle of poverty.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: At the University of Pennsylvania, Angela Lee Duckworth studies intangible concepts such as self-control and grit to determine how they might predict both academic and professional success.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: The author of "Investing in Kids," Timothy Bartik studies state and local economies -- and analyzes the benefits of preschool as an economic development program.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: ShaoLan want to help people understand China's culture and language, and to bridge the gap between East and West.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: A principal engineer at Intel, Maria Bezaitis focuses on how constellations of personal data can form new business models.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: By day, Judy MacDonald Johnston develops children's reading programs. By night, she helps others maintain their quality of life as they near death.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Hendrik Poinar is a geneticist and biological anthropologist who focuses on extracting ancient DNA. He currently has his sights set on sequencing the genome of the woolly mammoth -- and cloning it.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Paola Antonelli is on a mission to introduce -- and explain -- design to the world. With her shows at New York's Museum of Modern Art, she celebrates design's presence in every part of life.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Jackson Katz asks a very important question that gets at the root of why sexual abuse, rape and domestic abuse remain a problem: What's going on with men?

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Alex Laskey helps power companies to help their customers cut down -- using data analysis, marketing and a pinch of psychology.

talkTitle: How behavioral science can lower your energy bill

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Lisa Bu has built a career helping people find great stories to listen to. Now she tells her own story.

talkTitle: How books can open your mind

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Anas Aremeyaw Anas is a Ghanaian undercover journalist and private eye who gathers hard evidence of crime and corruption, putting the perpetrators behind bars.

talkTitle: How I named, shamed and jailed

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Andrew McAfee studies how information technology affects businesses and society.

talkTitle: What will future jobs look like?

speakerInfo.speakerBio: In his film "Mars et Avril," Martin Villeneuve brings his sci-fi romance graphic novel to glorious life.

talkTitle: How I made an impossible film

speakerInfo.speakerBio: TED Senior Fellow Camille Seaman photographs big ice and big clouds.

talkTitle: Photos from a storm chaser

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Raffaello D'Andrea explores the possibilities of autonomous technology by collaborating with artists, engineers and entrepreneurs.

talkTitle: The astounding athletic power of quadcopters

speakerInfo.speakerBio: George Papandreou draws on lessons learned from the Greek debt crisis as he helps guide the EU through difficult waters.

talkTitle: Imagine a European democracy without borders

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Manal al-Sharif advocates for women’s right to drive, male guardianship annulment, and family protection in Saudi Arabia.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Didier Sornette studies whether it is possible to anticipate big changes or predict crises in complex systems.

talkTitle: How we can predict the next financial crisis

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Paul Pholeros was a director of Healthabitat, a longstanding effort to improve the health of indigenous people by improving their living housing.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Juliana Rotich is the co-founder of Ushahidi, open-source software for collecting and mapping information -- and of iHub, a collective tech space in Nairobi, Kenya. She is a TED Senior Fellow.

talkTitle: Meet BRCK, Internet access built for Africa

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Joseph Kim escaped alone from North Korea at the age of 16, first to China and then to the United States.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Bob Mankoff is the cartoon editor of The New Yorker, as well as an accomplished cartoonist in his own right.

talkTitle: Anatomy of a New Yorker cartoon

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Paleontologist Michael Archer is working to bring back his favorite extinct animal: the Tasmanian tiger.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Mohamed Hijri studies arbuscular mycorrhizal fungi (AMF), seeking to understand the structure, evolution and reproduction of these organisms, which form a symbiotic relationship with plant roots.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Diana Reiss studies animal cognition, and has found that bottlenose dolphins (and Asian elephants) can recognize themselves in the mirror.

talkTitle: The interspecies internet? An idea in progress

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Dong Woo Jang turns an unusual stick of bamboo into an archer’s bow, an exploration of his cultural heritage and a metaphor for his perfect world.

talkTitle: The art of bow-making

speakerInfo.speakerBio: In "Plutocrats," Chrystia Freeland explores the growing gap between the working poor and the increasingly disconnected mega-rich.

talkTitle: The rise of the new global super-rich

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Paul Kemp-Robertson is the Cofounder and Editorial Director of Contagious Communications, a multi-platform marketing resource.

talkTitle: Bitcoin. Sweat. Tide. Meet the future of branded currency.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Philosopher Daniel H. Cohen studies language and the way we argue through reason.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Jinsop Lee is an industrial designer who believes that great design appeals to all five senses.

talkTitle: Design for all 5 senses

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Pianist Derek Paravicini understands music systematically. Once a child prodigy, he’s matured into a creative musician, able to reimagine songs in ways few can.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Most people look at cardboard tubes and see something fit for the recycling bin. But architect Shigeru Ban turns them into beautiful buildings.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Radio host Adam Spencer fills Sydney's drive-time mornings with smart math and science talk.

talkTitle: Why I fell in love with monster prime numbers

speakerInfo.speakerBio: The Beirut Marathon is the largest running event in the Middle East. May El-Khalil founded it as an instrument of peace.

talkTitle: Making peace is a marathon

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Alexa Meade paints mesmerizing, illusionistic portraits directly on living subjects, subverting familiar visual cues with perspective and color.

talkTitle: Your body is my canvas

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Kelly McGonigal translates academic research into practical strategies for health, happiness and personal success.

talkTitle: How to make stress your friend

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Principal of the New York media design firm, Local Projects, Jake Barton creates interactive and digital exhibits for the likes of the 9/11 Memorial Museum, Cleveland Museum of Art and Storycorps.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Blind almost since birth, Ron McCallum is one of Australia's most respected legal scholars, and an activist on behalf of disabled people around the globe.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Whether he’s taking on insecure hotspots, inept passwords, or lax OS designers, James Lyne exposes technology’s vulnerabilities while elevating the security awareness of everyday users.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Apollo Robbins will take the phone from your pocket and the ring off your finger, then hand them back to you and (maybe) show you how he did it.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: TED Senior Fellow Eric Berlow studies ecology and networks, exposing the interconnectedness of our ecosystems with climate change, government, corporations and more.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Andras Forgacs produces animal products -- meat and leather -- without the animal.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Benjamin Barber suggested that the future of the world may lie with the politicians who implement practical change every day: mayors.

talkTitle: Why mayors should rule the world

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Memory-manipulation expert Elizabeth Loftus explains how our memories might not be what they seem -- and how implanted memories can have real-life repercussions.

talkTitle: How reliable is your memory?

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Stuart Firestein teaches students and “citizen scientists” that ignorance is far more important to discovery than knowledge.

talkTitle: The pursuit of ignorance

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Baroness Onora O'Neill is a philosopher who focuses on international justice and the roles of trust and accountability in public life.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Writer, comic and mental health activist Kevin Breel speaks up about depression.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Kelli Swazey examines how religious and spiritual practices form group identity, and play a vital role in structuring the interactions of individuals within a culture.

talkTitle: Life that doesn't end with death

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Fabian Oefner creates stunning visual representations of natural forces.

talkTitle: Psychedelic science

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Jason Pontin is the editor-in-chief and publisher of MIT Technology Review.

talkTitle: Can technology solve our big problems?

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Michael Sandel teaches political philosophy at Harvard, exploring some of the most hotly contested moral and political issues of our time.

talkTitle: Why we shouldn't trust markets with our civic life

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Michael E. Porter wrote the books on modern competitive strategy for business. Now he is thinking deeply about the intersection between society and corporate interests.

talkTitle: The case for letting business solve social problems

speakerInfo.speakerBio: As commissioner of the NYC Department of Transportation under the Bloomberg administration, Janette Sadik-Khan was responsible for the smooth running of a New York that hides in plain sight ... the streets, highways, bridges, signs and lights.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Trita Parsi delves into Middle Eastern history and politics, uncovering fresh perspectives on Iranian, Israeli, and U.S. relations -- and discovers potential solutions to brewing conflicts.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Could our culture have misdiagnosed violence? As the director of the initiative Cure Violence, Gary Slutkin approaches gunfire on neighborhood streets as a contagious disease, looking to science and public health for strategies to stop it.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Andrew Fitzgerald is shaping new ways for Twitter and journalists to work together.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Dambisa Moyo is an international economist who analyzes the macroeconomy and global affairs.

talkTitle: Is China the new idol for emerging economies?

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Photographer Iwan Baan captures the many ways people shape their shared built environment -- from glossy starchitecture to handmade homes.

talkTitle: Ingenious homes in unexpected places

speakerInfo.speakerBio: In "The Cost of Hope," Pulitzer Prize winning journalist Amanda Bennett brings an investigative angle to the conversation about end-of-life care.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: In his compelling stage works, Hetain Patel uses powerful imagery and storytelling to examine questions of identity.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Steve Howard leads the sustainability effort at Ikea, helping the low-price-furniture giant to bring sustainable products to millions of people.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: In "The Fastest Billion," Charles Robertson re-examines the narrative of economic growth in African nations.

talkTitle: Africa's next boom

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Gian Giudice is a theoretical physicist who has contributed greatly to our present understanding of particle physics and cosmology.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Which actor in the economy is most responsible for making radical innovation happen? Mariana Mazzucato comes up with a surprising answer: the state.

talkTitle: Government — investor, risk-taker, innovator

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Holly Morris tells the stories of women around the world through documentary, television, print and the web.

talkTitle: Why stay in Chernobyl? Because it's home.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Robin Nagle is an anthropologist with a very particular focus... garbage.

talkTitle: What I discovered in New York City  trash

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Rodrigo Canales wants to understand how individuals influence organizations or systems--even those as complex as the Mexican drug cartels.

talkTitle: The deadly genius of drug cartels

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Grégoire Courtine and his interdisciplinary lab imagine new ways to recover after devastating, mobility-impairing injury to the spinal cord.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Using daring displays of algorithmic trickery, lightning calculator and number wizard Arthur Benjamin mesmerizes audiences with mathematical mystery and beauty.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Chris Downey is an architect who lost his sight and gained a new way of seeing the world.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Lian Pin Koh expands conservation efforts by championing the use of low-cost autonomous aerial vehicles.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: In 2003, Henry Evans became quadriplegic and mute after a stroke-like attack. Now, working with Robots for Humanity, he's a pioneer in adaptive robotic tech to help him, and other disabled people like him, navigate the world.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Andreas Raptopoulos and his colleagues are building the flying internet of things, using drones to carry essential goods to otherwise inaccessible areas.

talkTitle: No roads? There's a drone for that

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Jared Diamond investigates why cultures prosper or decline -- and what we can learn by taking a broad look across many kinds of societies.

talkTitle: How societies can grow old better

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Peter Doolittle is striving to understand the processes of human learning.

talkTitle: How your "working memory" makes sense of the world

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Suzana Herculano-Houzel shrunk the human brain by 14 billion neurons -- by developing a new way to count them.

talkTitle: What is so special about the human brain?

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Brother David Steindl-Rast, a Benedictine monk, meditates and writes on "the gentle power" of gratefulness.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Sally Kohn searches for common ground among political foes by focusing on the compassion and humanity in everyone.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Enrique Peñalosa is the mayor of Bogotá, Colombia. He advocates for sustainability and mobility in the cities of the future.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Rose George looks deeply into topics that are unseen but fundamental, whether that's sewers or latrines or massive container ships or pirate hostages or menstrual hygiene.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TED-curated event in partnership with BCG Singapore.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Diébédo Francis Kéré and his architectural firm design buildings that are good for the environment -- and those who use them.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: In his native South Africa, Boyd Varty builds wildlife corridors to restore the environment and literacy centers to restore the human spirit.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Philosopher Stephen Cave wants to know: Why is humanity so obsessed with living forever?

speakerInfo.speakerBio: The Chief Economist at General Electric, Marco Annunziata is a financial virtuoso with a passion for technology.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TED-curated event in partnership with BCG San Francisco.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Krista Donaldson is the CEO of D-Rev, a non-profit product development company improving the health and incomes of people around the world.

talkTitle: The $80 prosthetic knee that's changing lives

speakerInfo.speakerBio: A record-setting long-distance swimmer, Diana Nyad writes and thinks deeply about motivation.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Paul Piff studies how social hierarchy, inequality and emotion shape relations between individuals and groups.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Writer, actor, comedian, Maysoon Zayid is the co-founder of the New York Arab-American Comedy Festival.

talkTitle: I got 99 problems ... palsy is just one

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Sandra Aamodt explores the neuroscience of everyday life, examining new research and its impact on our understanding of ourselves.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Brothers Ryan and Hays Holladay explore the intersection of art and technology with an emphasis on music and sound, with projects ranging from multichannel audio installations to interactive performances to mobile apps.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TED-curated event in partnership with BCG San Francisco.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Harish Manwani joined Unilever as a management trainee in 1976; he is now the company's chief operating officer.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TED-curated event in partnership with BCG Singapore.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: As the COO at the helm of Facebook, Sheryl Sandberg juggles the tasks of monetizing the world’s largest social networking site while keeping its users happy and engaged.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: As a curator at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Luke Syson accesses the richness of European history through sculpture.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Can robots and humans interact the way that human beings interact with each other? Guy Hoffman researches embodied cognition and intelligence in robots.

talkTitle: Editor's note: This talk was recorded at a TEDx event organized by volunteers; speakers are selected independently of TED.

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Shereen El Feki works and writes on sexuality and social change in the Arab world.

talkTitle: A little-told tale of sex and sensuality

speakerInfo.speakerBio: Dr. Paula Johnson is a pioneer in looking at health from a woman's perspective.
